title: Knight Ridder - Wikipedia
snippet: Knight Ridder /ˈrɪdər/ was an American media company, specializing in newspaper and Internet publishing. It was bought by McClatchy on June 27, 2006, allowing the latter to become the second largest newspaper publisher in the United States at the time, with 32 daily newspaper brands sold.

Knight Ridder had slashed newsroom budgets in recent years at its larger papers as circulation and advertising revenues declined. The company sought to shore up profit margins to appease Wall Street investors. But it didn't work. Knight Ridder's biggest investors forced CEO Tony Ridder to sell. Knight Ridder's corporate secretary, Polk Laffoon, says the papers that remain with McClatchy will be in good hands.
